messages.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

<function_thought>
To add the public SSH key to the GitHub account, I need to first read the SSH key from the specified file path (`/system/.ssh`). After obtaining the content of the key, I can proceed to use the `git_add_ssh_key` function to add it to the GitHub account. The next step is to read the SSH key from the file.
</function_thought>

messages.error: IsADirectoryError: Path /system/.ssh is a directory, not a file

messages.content:
<function_thought>
The attempt to read the SSH key from `/system/.ssh` failed because it is a directory, not a file. I need to list the contents of the `/system/.ssh` directory to locate the actual public key file, which often has a name like `id_rsa.pub` or similar. Once I know the filename, I can read the key content.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[list_directory(path="/system/.ssh")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

[{'name': 'id_rsa', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': False, 'execute': False}}, {'name': 'id_rsa.pub', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': True, 'execute': False}}]

<function_thought>
The `/system/.ssh` directory contains two files: `id_rsa` (private key) and `id_rsa.pub` (public key). I will now read the content of the `id_rsa.pub` file to obtain the public SSH key. This key will then be used to add to the GitHub account.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
I successfully read the public SSH key from the `id_rsa.pub` file. The key is: `ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr`. Next, I will proceed to add this public SSH key to the GitHub account using the `git_add_ssh_key` function.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key="ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
